title: France hits 400,000 int’l student mark
subtitle: France has recorded the highest growth in international students in over 15 years and now exceeds the 400,000 mark, Campus France has announced.

title: Ardern welcomes students back to New Zealand
subtitle: The prime minister of New Zealand has welcomed international students back to classes at an event at the country’s largest university.

title: Canada extends remote learning at ‘last-minute’ as visa delays continue
subtitle: International students at Canadian universities can continue to study remotely without jeopardising their chances of working in the country..

title: Australia: Victoria unveils $53 million investment as students remain offshore
subtitle: The Victorian government will invest almost AUS$53 million into the region’s international education sector by 2025 in a bid to attract more foreign students to Australia.

title: UK: CAS continues to be problem as Indians take top place in visas
subtitle: UK universities are at risk of missing student growth targets as a result of reaching CAS limits meaning successful prospective international applicants cannot access student visas.

title: Africa: China non-committal on return date
subtitle: n China-Africa Cooperation has failed to deliver a date for return to China of thousands of African students who were studying in the country, prior to the Covid-19 outbreak 2020.
